climbs.name: Todd Vogel route aka "Arrow to your Heart"

content.description:
This is an old Todd Vogel route done in 79' or 80' it features hard moves to a first bolt (spinner) then 5.10 past it. the next section is X and may have tiny wires or available pin placements up to another old rusty bolt. More sustained steep slab to a fixed KB in a seam, then up and right to the anchor for Cheers and Jeers.

Quite a bold lead, bitd, I talked to Todd about it recently and it can be left to rust but others should respect the style of the FA (while it lasts) and not squeeze routes in next to it at this time.
content.protection: 2 bolts, FP and tiny wires or pins. Don't start up this one unless you are willing to solo it.
content.location: This route starts to the left of Cheers and Jeers and to the right of Thin Air. The first bolt can be seen from the base.

climbs.name: Thin Air
climbs.fa: Todd Vogel, John Tuttle and Norman Boles

content.description: Excellent face and crack climbing up center of wall. Superb rock quality.

climbs.name: Stage Fright (aka Cheers and Jeers)
climbs.fa: john robinson, brad johnson, mike carville

content.description: steep moves lead to stellar slab climbing on small to medium edges.
content.location: right side of dome - off ramp

climbs.name: Shangri-La
climbs.fa: brad johnson, john robinson, mike carville, derrick lindsay

content.description: climb off-set seam up face above on positive edges to ledge - excellent face climbing on flawless rock!
content.location: just left of thin air carck

content.description: cruxy move at second bolt leads to stellar face climbing on golden edges - same anchor as thin air
content.protection: 10 bolts to anchor w/ rap rings
content.location: bolted line between thin air and stage fright

climbs.name: Old Cranks
climbs.fa: John Tuttle, Todd Vogel and Norman Boles 1978.

content.description: This is the far left crack climb.  It is 5.8 or so. Easy and straight forward but good for working your trad skills.  Standard rack with nuts and mid to smaller cams.
content.location: Follow the marked trail to the base.  This is the climb on the far left.  Use the ramp to get to base of climb.

content.description: Thin face at bottom crux leads to technical climbing in the middle. Another crux getting on a ramp. Do not go to anchor for " Old Cranks". Go straight up through easy climbing past two more bolts to anchor.
content.location: Climb is just to the right of Unknown Trad Climb. 1st bolt on this route and the first bolt on "Dancing with the Devil" are close together.  Use first bolt on left.

climbs.name: Dancing With The Devil
climbs.fa: Brad Johnson, Mike Carville, John Robinson

content.description: Thin slab and face climb that's a little run out.   Fun moves going from first to second bolt.  Crux in the middle.  You can set up a top rope from Inferno.
content.protection: Bolted with Musseys at the top.
content.location: First bolt is only 4' right of the first bolt on Inferno.

climbs.name: Bataphobia
climbs.fa: John Robinson, Brad Johnson, Mike Carville

content.description: Easy face with fun moves at the top.
content.location: Up the ramp on the right to the farthest climb.
